Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient reports experiencing fluctuations in anxiety levels, with mindfulness practices providing some relief.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been trying mindfulness and exploring freelance writing, but fears rejection is holding them back from submitting work.
Psychosocial History: The patient has improved communication with their wife, discussing financial matters and working together on budgeting.

Progress Evaluation: The patient shows progress in managing anxiety and improving relationships, particularly with their wife.
Therapeutic Interventions: Continue focusing on mindfulness and exploring writing opportunities.
Next Steps: The patient plans to keep working on their goals and will discuss progress in the next session.
